public class AttributeSetProcessor
extends AttributeModifyProcessor

Processor which sets an attribute value to the result of an evaluated Expression.

Method Detail

modifySimpleRecord

public ISimpleRecord modifySimpleRecord(ISimpleRecord simpleRecord)
                                 throws RecordException
This will evaluate an expression, and put the result in the configured attribute.

If the attribute already exists, it is replaced. If not this modifier attempts to create it.

Specified by:
modifySimpleRecord in class AttributeModifyProcessor
Parameters:
simpleRecord - record to be modified.
Returns:
Modified ISimpleRecord record after modification
Throws:
RecordException - if the modification fails.

validate

public void validate(java.util.List exceptions)
Description copied from interface: IDataProcessor
This method checks that the current state of an implementation is "meaningful". Implementations of IDataProcessor are typically beans with zero-arg constructors. Implementations are encouraged to add exception to the list parameter rather than throwing them. This allows the calling code to collate the exceptions. If the implementation is an IComponent then the exceptions should be a ValidationException.

Specified by:
validate in interface IDataProcessor
Overrides:
validate in class AbstractSimpleRecordProcessor
